intro: Oxytheca emarginata, commonly known as the marginscale lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers with a subtle fragrance.
